pull.title: gitian-build.sh: fix signProg being recognized as two parameters
pull.body:
On current build script, `gpg --detach-sign` will be recognized as two parameters of gsign
This PR fix it and can build successfully

events.message: gitian-build.sh: fix signProg being recognized as two parameters

events.body: Could you please do the same to `doc/release-process.md`?

issue.title: doc: allow for SIGNER containing spaces
issue.body: SIGNER can contains space inside now. mentioned in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12527#issuecomment-370506416

issue.title: Easy to use gitian building script
issue.body:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8566 - Easy to use gitian building script
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11391 - Remove lxcbr0 lines from gitian-build.sh
f6b3382 (squashed into next commit), b9e79ab and 564a172 from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10773/
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12394 - gitian-builder.sh: fix --setup doc, since lxc is default
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12527 - gitian-build.sh: fix signProg being recognized as two parameters
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13320 - Ensure gitian-build.sh uses bash

Tested by building Windows and Linux versions for 0.11I and the sha256sums match.

Documentation for using this is located here: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/docs/blob/master/gitian-building.md

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -272,7 +272,7 @@ then
 	    echo "Compiling ${VERSION} Linux"
 	    echo ""
 	    ./bin/gbuild -j ${proc} -m ${mem} --commit bitcoin=${COMMIT} --url bitcoin=${url} ../bitcoin/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml
-	    ./bin/gsign -p $signProg --signer $SIGNER --release ${VERSION}-linux --destination ../gitian.sigs/ ../bitcoin/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml
+	    ./bin/gsign -p "$signProg" --signer $SIGNER --release ${VERSION}-linux --destination ../gitian.sigs/ ../bitcoin/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml
comments.body: Would it make sense to do the same for all the other arguments? E.g. `"$SIGNER"` would make it possible to have signer names with spaces in them.
